result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David C. Steffen

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 3:46pm
INCLUDES 15CM363, 15CM663, 15CM664, & 15CM798
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke.  Deft appears with Atty John Zich.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
15CM664:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor >> D&RI
15CM798:
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping- Misdemanor >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA:
15CM363:
Ct. 1 Disorderly Conduct >> NO CONTEST
15CM663:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor >> NO CONTEST
15CM798:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 1 year probation, concurrent. CONDITIONS: Complete any assessment, counseling, or treatment deemed necessary by agent. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Complete Mental Health assessment with follow through. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, can take prescriped medications as directed by physician. Subject to random testing to check for compliance. Deft is on disability and unable to maintain GFE. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. 78 days credit granted in 15CM798, 80 days credit granted in 15CM663, and 81 days credit granted in 15CM363. Deft is resident of Wood County and probation may be transferred to county of residence if county accepts deft. 

Adj: 4:04pm
Plea hearing on March 16, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

15CM664, 15CM798, 15CM663, and 15CM363
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer;  Defendant appears in person and with Atty John Zich; Date and time set for hearing to request second competency evaluation.  State informs Court, defendant withdraws requests.  COURT reviews file.  Court makes findings based on Dr. Galli's report and orders defendant be placed at Mendota Mental Health Institute along with Involuntary Medication Order.  State to prepare order.   COURT remands defendant to the custody of the Marathon County Sheriff's Dept. for transport.  Next Hearing:  Status Conference in 90 days.
